description.narrative:
with support from Oxfam, SDRC will organise delivery of cash transfer to 373 garbage collectors in October 2021. Details of delivery and monitoring is as follows:
• Oxfam and SDRC will develop a cash transfer implementation plan with specific steps of verification and cross check to ensure it reaches the right beneficiaries. • SDRC will provide a weekly update on progress and have regular meetings with Oxfam: on the situations and any issues/challenges, and adjustment needed; • A functional, user friendly feedback mechanism using hotlines of local CSO partner (SDRC), and Oxfam will be established at the onset of the project which will serve as a direct communication channel between Oxfam, local implementing partner, and targeted beneficiaries. We will activate these hotlines through-out the project to timely address any major complaints. • Oxfam and SDRC will do a joint post-distribution monitoring (PDM) of at least 5%-10% of cash recipients including information on what the cash grants were mainly spent for and provide an end of projectnarrative and financial report to Oxfam. • A brief communication and documentation plan will be developed by SDRC and Oxfam

participating-org.narrative: Social Development Research and Consultancy (SDRC) works on social development and research, and on training and consultancies in social work and community development in Vietnam. This will contribute to good models, especially in the area of health care. That iswhy SDRC is planning to combine services delivery with lobby. It will take three years to implement a pilot project on knowledge transfer to adolescents on health care and birth control.
Trung Tam nghien cuu tu van cong ta hoi va phat trien cong dong

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security

description.narrative: Women and Men able to: “# of people (M/F) living in poverty and injustice receiving cash to respond effectively to disasters”
Men directly supported by Oxfam Novib/partners with cash transfers to enhance their capabilities

comment.narrative: Since garbage collection requires people with strong health and resilience for tough conditions (evening/night shifts, and sanitary condition) to work, the number of men in this line of work is usually significantly larger than women. Moreover, during the pandemic time, more men are prioritized to take up the work so that women can stay at home and take care of small children.
